alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 7:48PM CDT until May 05 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Black River At Pocahontas affecting Randolph County. Black River At Black Rock affecting Jackson, Independence and Lawrence Counties. Cache River Near Patterson affecting Woodruff and Jackson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River At Pocahontas. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the river east and south of Pocahontas will be impacted by high water. Equipment and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 17.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning and continue falling to 15.5 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Crest Time Date Black River Pocahontas 17.0 17.9 Sun 7 PM 17.6 17.2 16.6 Falling &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
